sen.j: 小野駅（おのえき）は、京都市山科区にある、京都市営地下鉄京都市営地下鉄東西線の鉄道駅。
sen.e: Ono Station is a railroad station on the Kyoto City Subway Tozai Line, which is located in Yamashina Ward, Kyoto City.
Ono Station, located in Yamashina Ward, Kyoto City, is a railroad station on the Kyoto City Subway Tozai Line.
Ono Station, located in Yamashina Ward, Kyoto City, is a railroad station on the Kyoto Municipal Subway Tozai Line.

sen.j: 駅番号はT04。
sen.e: Its station number is T04.
Its station number is T04.
Its station number is T04.

sen.j: ホームは地下2層にあり、他の東西線の駅と同様、複線島式ホーム（1面2線）で、プラットホーム安全対策が設置されている。
sen.e: The platform, located on the second basement level, is a double-track, island platform (one platform for two lines) surrounded by safety barriers just like platforms of other Tozai Line stations.
The platform, located on the second basement level, is a double-track island (one platform for two lines) surrounded by safety barriers, like the platforms of other Tozai Line stations.
The platform, located on the second basement level, is a double-track island (one platform for two lines) surrounded by safety barriers, like the platforms of other Tozai Line stations.

sen.j: 東西線の駅は駅ごとにステーションカラーが制定されているが、小野駅のステーションカラーは紅梅色。
sen.e: Each Tozai Line station is assigned a unique station color; the station color of Ono Station is dark red.
Each Tozai Line station is assigned a unique station color, and the color for Ono Station is dark red.
Each Tozai Line station is assigned a unique station color, and the color for Ono Station is dark red.

sen.j: エレベーターはフジテック製が採用されている。
sen.e: Elevators at the station are made by Fujitec Co., Ltd.
The station's elevators were manufactured by Fujitec Co., Ltd.
The station's elevators were manufactured by Fujitec Co., Ltd.

sen.j: 勧修寺
sen.e: Kaju-ji Temple
Kaju-ji Temple
Kaju-ji Temple

sen.j: 随心院
sen.e: Zuishin-in Temple
Zuishin-in Temple
Zuishin-in Temple

sen.j: 明智光秀の塚
sen.e: Akechi Mitsuhide's Grave
Akechi Mitsuhide's Grave
Akechi Mitsuhide's Grave

sen.j: 旧東海道線山科駅跡
sen.e: Remains of the old Tokaido Line Yamashina Station
Remains of the old Tokaido Line Yamashina Station
Remains of the old Tokaido Line Yamashina Station

sen.j: 山科警察署
sen.e: Yamashina police station
The Yamashina police station
The Yamashina police station

sen.j: 京都外環状線
sen.e: Kyoto Outer Loop Expressway
Kyoto Outer Loop Expressway
Kyoto Outer Loop Expressway

sen.j: 名神高速道路(かつては、名神山科バスストップがあったが廃止された。)
sen.e: Meishin Expressway (there used to be a Meishin Yamashina bus stop around the station, but it is no longer used.)
Meishin Expressway (The former Meishin Yamashina bus stop near the station is no longer used.)
Meishin Expressway (The former Meishin Yamashina bus stop near the station is no longer used.)

sen.j: 京阪バス 四条河原町、醍醐三宝院、竹田駅ほか。
sen.e: Keihan bus services: buses for Shijo Kawaramachi, Daigo Sampo-in, Takeda Station, etc.
Keihan bus services: Bound for Shijo Kawaramachi, Daigo Sampo-in, Takeda Station, etc.
Keihan Bus: Bound for Shijo Kawaramachi, Daigo Sanpo-in, Takeda Station, etc.
sen.cmt: service を削除しました。Sanpo-in としました。

sen.j: 前後の駅間隔から、及び車庫入庫時に必要として駅の設置が決定された。
sen.e: Ono Station was built to adjust the distance between the adjacent stations and also because the station was needed to put trains in a train depot.
Ono Station was built to adjust the distance between the adjacent stations, but also because the station was needed in order to house trains in a train depot.
Ono Station was built to adjust the distance between the adjacent stations, but also because the station was needed in order to house trains in a train depot.

sen.j: 1995年（平成7年）7月3日 工事開始。
sen.e: The construction of the station was started on July 3, 1995.
The construction of the station commenced on July 3, 1995.
July 3, 1995: The construction of the station commenced.

sen.j: 1997年（平成9年）1月31日 完成。
sen.e: The construction was completed on January 31, 1995.
The process was completed on January 31, 1996.
January 31, 1997: The process was completed.
sen.cmt: 数字を修正しました。日付表記変更

sen.j: 1997年（平成9年）10月12日 東西線醍醐～二条間営業開始により開業。
sen.e: The station opened on November 12, when the train service started in the Tozai Line section between Daigo Station and Nijo Station.
The station opened on November 12, when train service started in the Tozai Line section between Daigo and Nijo stations.
October 12, 1997: The station was opened and commensurate with the launch of service between Daigo Station and Nijo Station on the Tozai Line.
sen.cmt: 他ファイルと表現を統一しました。日付表記変更

sen.j: 2007年（平成19年）4月1日 PiTaPa使用開始。
sen.e: On April 1, 2007, PiTaPa cards started to be used.
On April 1, 2007, PiTaPa cards came into use.
April 1, 2007: PiTaPa cards came into use.

sen.j: 小野という地名は平安時代の女流歌人小野小町の一族小野氏に由来する。
sen.e: The place name, Ono, derives from the name of the Ono clan, to which ONO no Komachi, a woman poet in the Heian Period, belonged.
The place name, Ono, is derived from the Ono clan, to which ONO no Komachi, a female poet in the Heian period, belonged.
The place name, Ono, is derived from the Ono clan, to which ONO no Komachi, a female poet in the Heian period, belonged.

sen.j: 近くの随心院には、小野小町が化粧したという伝説の残る井戸などがある。
sen.e: There is a legendary well in the nearby Zuishin-in Temple, which ONO no Komachi is believed to have used to wash herself.
There is a legendary well in the nearby Zuishin-in Temple, from which it's believed that ONO no Komachi drew water in order to wash herself.
There is a legendary well in the nearby Zuishin-in Temple, from which it's believed that ONO no Komachi drew water in order to wash herself.

sen.j: 京都市営地下鉄
sen.e: Kyoto City Subway
Kyoto City Subway
Kyoto Municipal Subway

sen.e: Tozai Line
Tozai Line

sen.j: 醍醐駅_(京都府)(T03) - 小野駅(T04) - 椥辻駅(T05)
sen.e: Daigo Station (Kyoto Prefecture) (T03) - Ono Station (T04) - Nagitsuji Station (T05)
